title: Realtor Safety Information - Greater Springfield Board of Realtors

contentTree.content:
FOREWARN

GSBOR is excited to partner with FOREWARN to bring you cutting-edge technology designed to improve REALTOR® safety and security. All primary and secondary GSBOR REALTOR® members are eligible for Premium app features at no additional cost.

FOREWARN brings knowledge to the real estate industry through innovative solutions to ensure safer engagements and smarter interactions. Leveraging powerful analytics and a massive data repository, FOREWARN solutions enable real estate professionals to gain real-time knowledge, for purposes such as verifying identity, searching for criminal histories, and validating information provided by potential clients such as financial and asset information – all from just a phone number or name. Risk assessment and due diligence at your fingertips™.

REALTOR® Safety Information

REALTOR® safety is of the utmost importance. Use the classes and resources below to help develop personal safety strategies.

While being friendly and personable is a key to success for REALTORS®, it is critical to show caution when meeting clients for the first time.

Visit the NAR Safety Resources below for a full list of articles and videos on REALTOR® safety.

REALTOR® Safety Resources
Safety Articles

It’s crucial to have a comprehensive knowledge of how to protect yourself in all aspects of your real estate business. View articles about every part of real estate safety on the NAR safety page.

LEARN MORE
Safety Videos

Staying up-to-date on the latest safety procedures is essential to protecting yourself and your business. View and share videos about REALTOR® safety from the NAR.

LEARN MORE
Have a Question About REALTOR® Safety?

Don’t hesitate to fill out a contact form, email or call. One of our friendly staff members would be happy to help you.

CONTACT US

Web Accessibility
children.html: Web Accessibility

children.content: Web Accessibility

Greater Springfield Board of Realtors®, Inc. is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone and applying relevant accessibility standards.

If you have difficulty accessing content, have difficulty viewing a file on the website, or notice any accessibility problems, please contact us to specify the nature of the accessibility issue and any assistive technology you use. We will strive to provide the content you need in the format you require.
